org.sadun.text.ffp
Class LinePushbackReader

java.lang.Object
  org.sadun.text.ffp.LinePushbackReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
FlatFileParser.LineReader
public class LinePushbackReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements FlatFileParser.LineReader

A class which reads readers inexpensively and allows to push back read lines.

A mark() operation ensures that if reset() is invoked, the reader is rewind to the marked position.

This implementation supports multiple nested mark() operations.

Author:
Cristiano Sadun

Method Detail

readLine

public java.lang.String readLine()
                          throws java.io.IOException
Read one line.

Specified by:
readLine in interface FlatFileParser.LineReader
Returns:
the next line of text, or null if no such line exist.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs while reading the line

mark

public void mark()
Marks the current reading point. A matching reset() will re-point the reader to this point.

Multiple marks are allowed - the corresponding reset() will unstack each mark in turn.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the reading point to the last mark. If no marks exist, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no marks have been previously set

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes the reader.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

atEOF

public boolean atEOF()
Return whether or not there are more lines to read.

Returns:
whether or not there are more lines to read.
